intro: Lippia pallescens, commonly known as silverleaf lippia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It has aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Lippia pallescens is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
